Detailed Description

a structure needed to built a hash index of mapped reads

A structure needed to built a hash index of mapped reads

Field Documentation

char* result_hash::direction_and_matching_qgrams

holds the direction of this hit together with the matching qgrams:
0:forward, start and end qgram match
1:forward, start qgram match
2:forward, end qgram match
3:forward, neither start or end match
4:reverse, start and end qgram match
5:reverse, start qgram match
6:reverse, end qgram match
7:reverse, neither start or end match

Referenced by add_start_position(), clear_result_hash(), and prepare_cuda_alignments().

UT_hash_handle result_hash::hh

makes this structure hashable

Referenced by prepare_cuda_alignments().

unsigned short int result_hash::next_pos

next position in the following postions array

Referenced by add_start_position(), and prepare_cuda_alignments().

int* result_hash::positions

holds the unique start positions of this read in the genome - dynamicly resized

Referenced by add_start_position(), clear_result_hash(), and prepare_cuda_alignments().

unsigned int result_hash::read_id

KEY: (unique) number of the read

Referenced by add_start_position(), prepare_cuda_alignments(), and run_seashore().
